title: Legacy
description: Modules that are deprecated, archived or superseded. Listed here for the historical record.

level-delete-stream.description: A streams1 deleteStream for [levelup]. Superseded by `db.clear()`.

level-delete-range.description: Delete a range of keys from [levelup]. Superseded by `db.clear()`.

level-browserify.description: Bundle for [level-js] and [leveldown]. No longer maintained: superseded by [level] v5.0.0.

level-mapped-index.description: Indexes for [levelup] built on [map-reduce]. Uses a custom indexing function for each index to parse and record index values for each entry. Archived.

level-encoding.description: Implements the encoding logic of a [levelup]-like database. This functionality lives on in [level-codec].

byteup.description: Adds [bytewise] as a native encoding for [levelup]. This can now be achieved with [encoding-down] and `{ keyEncoding: bytewise }`.

msgpackup.description: Adds [msgpack](https://github.com/msgpack/msgpack) as a native encoding for [levelup]. This can now be achieved with [encoding-down] and `{ keyEncoding: msgpack }`.

level-cbatch.description: Provides a chainable API for `db.batch()`. This functionality is now provided by [levelup].

levelup-iterator.description: Use [abstract-leveldown] iterators instead of readable streams to traverse the database. Iterators are exposed by [levelup] since `levelup@3.1.0`.

levelidb.description: A [levelup] interface on top of IndexedDB. Superseded by [level-js] and [level].

level-multiply.description: Make [levelup] `get()`, `put()` and `del()` methods accept multiples keys & values. Archived.

level-namespace.description: Split your db up into multiple namespaces. Deprecated.

q-level.description: [levelup] with Q promises. [levelup] has native Promise support now.

level-static.description: Use [levelup] as a static file server. Abandoned.

level-spaces.description: A simple namespacing solution for [levelup]. Deprecated.

level-object.description: Store objects in [levelup]. Author recommends [level-pathwise] instead.

level-scuttlebutt.description: Persist and query scuttlebutt documents (requires [level-sublevel]). Abandoned.

gun-level.description: Sync graph-style data real-time between browsers and servers. Discontinued.

level-co.description: [levelup] wrappers for [co](https://github.com/tj/co). Instead use native ES6 features.

level-session.description: Framework-agnostic, LevelDB-backed web server session manager. Archived.

level-socket.description: Backend server that exposes [levelup] over authenticated cross domain websockets.

level-user.description: Client side library for authenticating with and moving data over [level-socket].

range-bucket.description: Generate string ranges that group into ranges, suitable for use as database keys. Abandoned.

level-partition-check.description: Extend [levelup] to error if you write outside of a specified range of keys. Stalled work in progress.

level-bytewise.description: [levelup] with [bytewise] key encoding and bytewise-friendly sublevels.

level-peek.description: Get the first or last record in a range. Abandoned.

level-prebuilt.description: Same as [level] but with prebuilt binaries. This is now provided by [level] too.

level-promise.description: [levelup] with Promises. This is now provided by [levelup] out of the box.

level-search.description: Index and search every property in [levelup] containing object values. Abandoned.

level-scout.description: Range search with a query planner. Development stalled.

leveldown-android-prebuilt.description: Defunct fork of [leveldown] to add Android support. Merged into `leveldown`.

leveldown-prebuilt.description: Defunct fork of [leveldown] to add prebuilt binaries. Now provided by `leveldown`.

level-map-index.description: Another indexing module. Adapted from [map-reduce]. Author recommends other solutions.

level-memview.description: In memory view on top of [levelup]. Abandoned.

description: HTTP request handlers for building web services on top of LevelDB. Not in active development.
